.class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ILongPredicate implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type ILongPredicate = interface interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: Represents a predicate (boolean-valued function) of one long-valued argument.

remarks.para: Represents a predicate (boolean-valued function) of one long-valued argument. This is the long-consuming primitive type specialization of Predicate.
This is a functional interface whose functional method is #test(long).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: a predicate that will be logically-ANDed with this predicate
Docs.summary: Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate and another.
Docs.returns: a composed predicate that represents the short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate and the other predicate

remarks.para: Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical AND of this predicate and another. When evaluating the composed predicate, if this predicate is false, then the other predicate is not evaluated.
Any exceptions thrown during evaluation of either predicate are relayed to the caller; if evaluation of this predicate throws an exception, the other predicate will not be evaluated.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: a predicate that will be logically-ORed with this predicate
Docs.summary: Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and another.
Docs.returns: a composed predicate that represents the short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and the other predicate

remarks.para: Returns a composed predicate that represents a short-circuiting logical OR of this predicate and another. When evaluating the composed predicate, if this predicate is true, then the other predicate is not evaluated.
Any exceptions thrown during evaluation of either predicate are relayed to the caller; if evaluation of this predicate throws an exception, the other predicate will not be evaluated.
